Articles.Content:
After the 1.3 update, when I launch KSP, it begins to load up to a certain point, where it tries to load the vernor engine, but from there it just crashes, giving this report:

Unity Player [version: Unity 5.4.0p4_b15b5ae035b7]

mono.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module mono.dll at 0023:100704db.

Error occurred at 2017-05-25_221910.
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Gabriel.
26% memory in use.
0 MB physical memory [0 MB free].
0 MB paging file [0 MB free].
0 MB user address space [2806 MB free].
Read from location 00000000 caused an access violation.

Context:
EDI:    0x3af1de58  ESI: 0x00000000  EAX:   0x00efe818
EBX:    0x319f1780  ECX: 0x3af1de58  EDX:   0x00000067
EIP:    0x100704db  EBP: 0x00efe81c  SegCs: 0x00000023
EFlags: 0x00010212  ESP: 0x00efe768  SegSs: 0x0000002b

 

I've tried to restart my computer and load the game to no avail. Any help?

14 minutes ago, Stopthat84 said:

0 MB physical memory [0 MB free].
0 MB paging file [0 MB free].
0 MB user address space [2806 MB free].

It appears Unity is not seeing any memory in your machine for some reason.  I would suggest verifying your game files through steam and trying again, if that doesn't work do a full wipe of the game and re-install.

It turned out that 9 files had to be reacquired when I verified them, but once I ran KSP again it still crashes when it loads the Vernor engine, and Unity still doesn't see any memory. I'm just going to re-install and see what happens.
